serve-drinks.step_contents: Serve beverages. There are various Japanese-themed drinks you can serve at your party. If it’s a kid’s party, you’ll of course want to stick to non-alcoholic options. If it’s an adult party, you may want to include both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverage choices.[6] Some examples of non-alcoholic beverages you can serve are green tea, cherry blossom tea, soy milk, and Japanese sodas from a local Asian grocer. Alcoholic options include sake, Japanese beer, and wine.

drink: There are various Japanese-themed drinks you can serve at your party.
If it’s an adult party, you may want to include both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverage choices.
Some examples of non-alcoholic beverages you can serve are green tea, cherry blossom tea, soy milk, and Japanese sodas from a local Asian grocer.
Alcoholic options include sake, Japanese beer, and wine.

here are various Japanese-themed drinks you can serve at your party.

open: There are various Japanese-themed drinks you can serve at your party.

decorate.step_contents:
Put out anime balloons. Draw anime faces on balloons. Alternately, you can call local party supply stores to see if they have any relevant balloons. A third option is to purchase anime balloons online. You can have the balloons filled with helium, or blow them up yourself and place them around. Try asking, “Do you have any anime or manga balloons, like Pokémon, Dragon Ball or Naruto?” These are well-recognized series and will help give the party store employee a better idea of what you’re looking for.
Hang paper lanterns. Buy paper lanterns, in the color of your party theme, at a party supply store or online. You can also make paper lanterns using tissue paper and bendable metal wire.
Consider playing anime on TV or DVD. You can play it with the sound low or off if you don’t want it to compete with the music. If you have a projector you can use with a DVD player or computer, you can project anime onto the wall. You may want to watch some classic anime shows like Yu Yu Hakusho, Pokémon or Dragon Ball Z.

inflated: You can have the balloons filled with helium, or blow them up yourself and place them around.
hung: You can have the balloons filled with helium, or blow them up yourself and place them around.

hang_lantern: Hang paper lanterns. Buy paper lanterns, in the color of your party theme, at a party supply store or online. You can also make paper lanterns using tissue paper and bendable metal wire.
blow_balloon: Draw anime faces on balloons. Alternately, you can call local party supply stores to see if they have any relevant balloons. A third option is to purchase anime balloons online. You can have the balloons filled with helium, or blow them up yourself and place them around.
turn_on_tv: Consider playing anime on TV or DVD. You can play it with the sound low or off if you don’t want it to compete with the music. If you have a projector you can use with a DVD player or computer, you can project anime onto the wall. You may want to watch some classic anime shows like Yu Yu Hakusho, Pokémon or Dragon Ball Z.

cook-food.step_contents: Make or order main and side dishes. If you’re planning to have a large party, it might be easier to order food than make it. Find Japanese restaurants in local directories online or in the yellow pages. Ideas for main dishes include teriyaki meat or salmon, and stir fry with chicken or beef, noodles, vegetables, and toasted sesame seed sauce.[4] Some examples of appetizers or side dishes are sushi, fried rice, soup, clams steamed in butter and sake, and fried shrimp with dipping sauces.[5]

anime-party.wikihow_title: How to Throw an Anime Party

direction.description: A way you can travel between locations

go.description: The player moves in a specific direction from his current location to another location
go.prerequisites: The player must move to a location reachable from his current location via the correct direction
go.results: The player ends up in the new location

get.description: The player grabs an item that is present at the current location
get.prerequisites: The item needs to be at the current location that the player is at

drop.description: The player drops an item from their inventory to the current location
drop.prerequisites: The player needs to have the item in their inventory
drop.results: The item is now at the player's current location instead of inside their inventory

cook.prerequisites: The player needs to be at an location with a kitchen
cook.results: The player obtains the desired food

order_sushi.description: The player uses their phone to order sushi
order_sushi.prerequisites: The player needs to have their phone and some money

buy_sake.description: The player buys sake using their phone and some money
buy_sake.prerequisites: The player needs their phone and some money

serve.description: The player opens and serves the food item to their guests
serve.prerequisites: The player needs to have the drink in their inventory
serve.results: The drink is opened and left at the player's current location

brew.prerequisites: The player needs a teabag in their inventoryh

get_beer.description: The player can pull beer from their fridge
get_beer.prerequisites: The player needs to be in a location with a fridge

open.prerequisites: The player needs to have the drink in their inventory

hang_lantern.prerequisites: The player needs a lantern in their inventory

blow_balloon.description: The player blows up a balloon
blow_balloon.prerequisites: The player needs a balloon in their inventory
blow_balloon.results: The balloon is blown up and setup in the room

turn_on_tv.description: The player turns on a tv
turn_on_tv.prerequisites: The player needs to be in the location the tv is at

at.description: An object is at a location

inventory.description: An object is in the player's inventory

connected.description: A location is connected to another location in one direction

opened.description: A drink is opened for consumption
